e_header: Translating the Voice of the Customer
e_text:
Design input includes the voice of the customer, regulatory requirements, and information taken from similar product ideas.

While all of these are important, the most vital is the voice of the customer.

The House of Quality (HOQ) is a commonly used tool that captures the voice of the customer in the form of the customers voiced and unarticulated wants and needs and translates these into customer requirements: categories that reflect those wants and needs. 3M teams often use a streamlined version of the HOQ called the Linear House of Quality (LHOQ).

Note that depending on your project or division, the HOQ or LHOQ may not be a required tool. However, if it is not, a similar tool for capturing the voice of the customer will be used. For the purpose of your learning journey, we will explore the LHOQ as our example.
